final_poem:
In mindscape's garden, memories bloom bright and wild,  
With each petal unfurling tales of joy or guild;   
Fragile whispers in time’ endlessly swayed—    
Etching imprint on soul as days are laid.  
Memories weave a tapestry so wide 
And richly hued, deep inside the mind's eye where I reside... and dwell;   
Intricately entwined like golden threads in loom of thought—    
Anxieties lost to echoes soft as silk.  
Each recollection a doorway unto past selves 
And lives once lived, each story tenderly told by its own hands:         
Splintered moments held aloft on silent wings   
In the sanctum of my mind’s eternal spring...
